availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Littleberry Withers (Princeton, Caldwell County, Kentucky, postmaster)

body.p: Princeton, Kentucky, postmaster. Kentucky native. Son of Harold E. Withers. Married to Ann Ritchey Withers in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on August 31, 1837. Father of Thomas R. Withers, Francis M. Withers, Anne Withers, James H. Withers, John W. Withers, Alice Withers, William Withers, and Mary Withers. Postmaster in Princeton from July 31, 1845, to December 30, 1850. Postmaster in Princeton from September 17, 1852, to 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 344B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 109.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 515A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000851644.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, Records of the Post Office Department, NARA Series M841, RG 28, pp. 576-77.
